title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=d7cc8834fbf21d8da84189cc06a5b7e1b5677686
comments: I have been playing Ancestors The Humankind Odyssey for a while now. Pretty interesting game. Very grindy, but also a very unique game. The game can be quite difficult too because you are barely told anything and have to learn things similarly to what our ancestors did.
I really enjoyed this game. Reminded me of old school Age of Empires single-player campaigns.

Dying light.

Hard af and scary af.

Horizon Forbidden West. Bought it in December, started playing it a couple of days ago. Not because of a backlog but because I know once I complete the game I'm going to go into withdrawal. It's just so gorgeous. I love the world so much and I'm already missing it.

light_cleaned_comments: Any Marvel Snap fans? I have been playing Ancestors The Humankind Odyssey for a while now. Pretty interesting game. Very grindy, but also a very unique game. The game can be quite difficult too because you are barely told anything and have to learn things similarly to what our ancestors did. I really enjoyed this game. Reminded me of old school Age of Empires single-player campaigns. EMPRESS ki jai ho Did the sub get banned? Yup Dying light. Hard af and scary af. Horizon Forbidden West. Bought it in December, started playing it a couple of days ago. Not because of a backlog but because I know once I complete the game I'm going to go into withdrawal. It's just so gorgeous. I love the world so much and I'm already missing it.
